casebody.data:
Merrimack,

June 30, 1902. United States Fidelity & Guaranty Co. v. Linehan, Ins. Comm'r. Fidelity & Casualty Co. of New York v. Same. Petition's, for mandamus, to compel the issuance of licenses by the defendant to the petitioners. Transferred from the October term, 1901, of the superior court by Stone, J. Streeter & Hollis, for the plaintiffs. Eastmian & Hollis, for the defendant. Remick, J.

The facts before the court are conflicting and uncertain, and for that reason do not warrant the issuance of a writ of mandamus. Stevens v. Fellows, 70 N. H. 148, 150; Stearns v. Barrett, 1 Mason 153; High Ex. Rem., s. 9; 19 Am. &. Eng. Enc. Law (2d ed.) 726, 727, and numerous authorities there cited.

Case discharged.

All concurred.
